thread.title: Cheika assessing injuries before naming XV for quarterfinals
thread.title_full: Cheika assessing injuries before naming XV for quarterfinals - The Times of India

author: timesofindia.indiatimes.com
title: Cheika assessing injuries before naming XV for quarterfinals
text:
LONDON: Australia coach Michael Cheika has delayed announcing his starting lineup for the Rugby World Cup quarterfinal against Scotland so he can assess the fitness of backrower David Pocock.
Pocock left the field late in the 15-6 win over Wales in the Pool A decider last Saturday with an injured left calf muscle, and skipped training early in the week, but was expected to practice later Friday ahead of Sunday's match.
The squad will be finalized after practice.
"There's no chance for resting. This is knockout footy, and every day is the biggest day," Cheika said. "If he's fit, he'll play."
Cheika said he was confident fullback Israel Folau would recover from an ankle problem that has limited his preparations.
The Wallabies coach said he wouldn't be resting any players for the match. Stay updated on the go with Times of India News App. Click here to download it for your device.
